title: Ant and Dec are left stranded in the freezing Arctic in new fun I'm A Celebrity trailer
text:
Viewers have been voting to decide how the Geordie duo will get to Australia via boat in the fun adverts.

And on Friday the new I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! trailer was released after fans voted for Ant McPartlin and Dec Donnelly to face 'Arctic Antics' as the second part of their journey to the jungle.

In the fun video, which will premiere on ITV on Friday night, it sees Ant and Dec stranded in the polar region located at the northernmost part of Earth.

New trailer: On Friday the new I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! trailer was released after fans voted for Ant McPartlin and Dec Donnelly to face 'Arctic Antics' as the second part of their journey to the jungle

Ant is wrapped up warmly with a scarf and two pairs of gloves while freezing Dec is covered in ice as he dons a sailor hat, thin shirt and white trousers.

As the boat moors in, a confused Ant says: 'Well, I'm pretty sure this isn't Australia...'

With a shivering Dec stuttering: 'It's f-f-f-f-freezing.'

To which a bemused Ant quips: 'I wasn't sure what you were going to say there pal. Do you want to borrow my gloves?'

Cold? In the fun video, which will premiere on ITV on Friday night, it sees Ant and Dec stranded in the polar region located at the northernmost part of Earth

Lost at sea: Ant is wrapped up warmly with a scarf and two pairs of gloves while freezing Dec is covered in ice as he dons a sailor hat, thin shirt and white trousers

The presenter then takes off a pair of gloves to reveal he is wearing another pair of gloves underneath, to which an annoyed Dec rants: 'Unbelievable!'

And things go from bad to worse when Dec then remarks: 'I am f-f-f-famished' and Ant offers him a rocket ice lolly with the presenter turning it away.

Yet an optimistic Ant doesn't stop Dec's rejection dampen his spirits as he says: 'Oh, suit yourself. Where next?'

Viewers voted for Ant and Dec to have 'Arctic Antics', which secured 59%, as their next trailer instead of Tropical Tides.

Confused: As the boat moors in, a confused Ant says: 'Well, I'm pretty sure this isn't Australia...' as he lends freezing Dec a pair of one of his many gloves

Hungry: And things go from bad to worse when Dec then remarks: 'I am f-f-f-famished' and Ant offers him a rocket ice lolly with the presenter turning it away

Show watchers will have the choice to vote for two new scenarios for the next trailer at the end of the advert on Friday night.

Fans will have the choice between Stormy Seas or Something Fishy on the I'm A Celebrity app.

The new clip comes after ITV released the first trailer for the new series of I'm A Celebrity earlier this month.

Optimistic: Yet an optimistic Ant doesn't stop Dec's rejection dampen his spirits as he says: 'Oh, suit yourself. Where next?'

Public vote: Viewers voted for Ant and Dec to have 'Arctic Antics', which secured 59%, as their next trailer instead of Tropical Tides

In the trailer, Ant and Dec appear to be stranded in a broken-down speedboat in the ocean, with no clue where to go.

As Dec bemoans: 'I knew we should have got the bus to Australia,' Ant peers through a telescope at his pal before joking: 'You've shrunk!'

Pulling out a map Dec insists: 'Stop messing about you and get navigating,' before pointing out that Ant is holding map upside-down.

Next mission: Show watchers will have the choice to vote for two new scenarios for the next trailer at the end of the advert on Friday night

Poking fun at the Down Under trope, Ant says: 'We're going to Australia stupid.'

But the map blows out of the host's hands, and as Dec says: 'Oh dear,' his pal adds: 'What do we do now.'

Viewers were then told that they can vote to decide how Ant and Dec will make it to Australia, by voting for different options on the app.

Drama: The new clip comes after ITV released the first trailer for the new series of I'm A Celebrity earlier this month

Clueless: Dec tasks Ant with taking care of the map, but it seems unlikely they'll get very far as he thinks Australia is 'upside down'

He's so tiny! Ant also once again poked fun at Dec's height as he peered at his pal through a telescope

ITV then reveals that the new series will begin sometime in November, although an official date is yet to be confirmed.

While ITV shared the trailer on their social media accounts, Ant and Dec also shared the post with the caption: 'Get us Out Of Here! Please?! #ImACeleb is coming… but you have to help us get to the jungle first! Download the @imacelebrity app to choose where we go next.'

The new series marks Ant's first time back in the jungle since 2017, which came before his drink-drive arrest and subsequent break from presenting.

While Ant was replaced by presenter Holly Willoughby last series, bosses had previously confirmed that he would always return to the show following his TV hiatus.

Disastrous: The trailer ends on a cliffhanger, as Ant loses the map leaving him and Dec stranded with no clue where to go

Your turn! Viewers were then told that they can vote to decide how Ant and Dec will make it to Australia, by voting for different options on the app

It was previously reported that ITV had splashed the cash on this year's trailer, which is the first in an interactive series.

A source told The Sun: 'The storyline for the promo is really funny, it’s a big and very expensive set-up with masses of special effects, but they wanted it to be right — especially for Ant’s return.

'Holly was a fantastic stand-in and Dec enjoyed having her with him in Australia very much, but she always said it was a one-off.

'Ant is a huge part of the success of the series so everyone on the team was looking forward to working with him again.'
